text:
Hi everyone! :wave:

I'm the sole copywriter on my team and I'm in dire need of some feedback. There's not loads of people I can ask for feedback round here, so looking for some thoughts from the good people of this group!

We're building a new marketing site for our SaaS company – and I was hoping to ask for some feedback on <https://charlie-hr.webflow.io/?fbclid=IwAR0yeBO_FohOy-pEx8IDcbN679jnS7fTkQxSfLgjM7kC6taYuF1fOS8C7ug|a WIP-progress home page>.

*For context*: the goal of the page is to convert readers to a free trial/demo of a SaaS product. My company (Charlie) sells HR software to UK-based small companies and startups.

*The buyer persona* is quite broad... they are usually either a startup founder/CEO of a small 10-person company, or maybe an Office Manager/HR person at team of 30ish. There's lots of variation within the exact role though, and also in how knowledgeable they are about HR.

Charlie positions themselves as an aspirational, progressive brand within a pretty traditional HR software category. They like to emphasise a focus on company culture and taking care of your team, over and above just 'traditional' HR functions.

I hope that's enough context to be useful - I would love to hear people's thoughts on the copy as it stands so far. Thank you all for reading!

attachments.title: Charlie HR
attachments.text: Everything you need to manage your team and craft your culture – all in one place.
